column4: hey... I'd like to install ubuntu but currently i dont have any free partition.. is it possible to repartition one of my hds? and if so which, slave or master?
yes you can, and it dosent matter
theres always the chance.. and there is loads of docs on the ubuntu wiki site.
when in doubt.. back up stuff.
i do it all the time. - i tend to use a live cd, with gparted, or qt_parted - however for the repartitiong.. and READ the docs on the 2 programs.
if you want fast.. go with somthing really minimal. :P
speed is relative.
i guess i'll try xubuntu sometime.. (: should be fast?
ye... but something with lower requiriments should be a bit faster? right?
just apt-get install xubuntu-desktop and select it from the GDM login and try it.
oh a high end system - i doubt ya could tell.. on a low end system it will be more noticeable.
okay, so on low end system? do you know?
define 'low end' :P
duh :P just your personal opinion? =)
yes but if the choises are pure ubuntu or kubuntu.. out of the box (:
try them and see.. i dont worry about stuff like that.
yep i will (:
let me guess.. NTFS partition?
aye
it's already mounted.. just cant access it (:
you have to alter the mount entry
okay, I'll check it. thanks
its mounted by root. not a user.
